steps.title: Mix a 1:1 ratio of 10 volume developer and bleach powder.
steps.content: Mix a 1:1 ratio of 10 volume developer and bleach powder. Start with 4 tablespoons (59 mL) of developer and 4 tablespoon (59.1 ml) (56 g) of bleach powder in a plastic bowl. Mix them together with a hair dye brush until they form a smooth paste. [1] X Research source You can find bleach powder and developer at most beauty supply stores. Use a different strength developer based on how dark your hair is and how light you want it. For example, if you are starting from deep red and want to move to super light red, choose a 30 or 40 volume developer. If you are wanting to only move 1 to 2 shades lighter, stick with a 10 volume developer.

steps.title: Add the bleach to 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of clarifying shampoo.
steps.content: Add the bleach to 2 tablespoons (30 mL) of clarifying shampoo. Pick a harsh shampoo that strips your hair of its natural oils to remove the color better, like a clarifying or dandruff shampoo. [2] X Expert Source April Ferri Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 8 December 2020. Pour in some of the shampoo and mix it in with the bleach and developer mixture. [3] X Research source Adding shampoo makes the bleach mixture easier to put on your hair. Test the bleach on a strand of your hair before applying it to your whole head. [4] X Expert Source April Ferri Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 8 December 2020.

steps.title: Wet your hair in the shower or sink.
steps.content: Wet your hair in the shower or sink. Make sure your whole head is fully damp and your hair is wet from roots to ends. Use cold water to protect the health of your hair and close up the cuticles as much as possible. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Put on gloves to protect your hands.
steps.content: Put on gloves to protect your hands. Even though the bleach is diluted, it can still irritate your skin. Use rubber or latex gloves to protect your hands and keep your skin safe. [6] X Research source You can pick up gloves at the beauty supply store when you buy your bleach and developer, or look for them at any home goods store.

steps.title: Rub the mixture into your hair, starting with the ends.
steps.content: Rub the mixture into your hair, starting with the ends. Keep the bowl of your bleach mix near you as you work. Put on gloves to protect your hands and rub the mixture into your hair from the ends up to the roots. Make sure you cover your entire head as best as possible. [7] X Research source Bleach can cause skin irritation if you touch it with your bare hands. [8] X Expert Source April Ferri Professional Hair Stylist Expert Interview. 8 December 2020. The roots of your hair get hot from the heat of your scalp, so if you put bleach on them first, they will get lighter than the rest of your hair.

steps.title: Let the mixture sit for 10 to 30 minutes.
steps.content: Let the mixture sit for 10 to 30 minutes. You may be able to see your hair lighten as you watch it sit. Keep your hair uncovered so that it doesn’t get too hot and check on it after 10 minutes. If it still isn't light enough, leave it on for another 20 minutes. [9] X Research source Using a bleach wash may lighten your hair 1 to 2 shades, depending on how dark it is.

steps.title: Rinse your hair with cool water to get the bleach out.
steps.content: Rinse your hair with cool water to get the bleach out. Cold water is less damaging for your hair and will close up your cuticles to keep the red color in. Make sure all of the bleach is out, but don’t use any shampoo as you rinse. [10] X Research source Use conditioner on your hair after you rinse it to add some moisture back in after drying it out with bleach.

steps.title: Mix baking soda and hydrogen peroxide in a plastic bowl.
steps.content: Mix baking soda and hydrogen peroxide in a plastic bowl. Put 1 cup (128 g) of baking soda and 3 tablespoons (44 mL) of hydrogen peroxide into a bowl mix them together with a spoon until they form a paste. The mixture may fizz up as you start mixing it, but that’s okay. [11] X Research source Hydrogen peroxide is a natural lightener. Mixing it with baking soda forms a paste that can sit on your hair to lighten it. Keep hydrogen peroxide away from your eyes to avoid irritation.

steps.title: Brush the mixture onto your hair with a hair dye brush.
steps.content: Brush the mixture onto your hair with a hair dye brush. Start with the ends of your hair and use a hair dye brush to work up to the roots. Cover your hair as evenly as possible so that it lightens without any patches. [12] X Research source You can also use gloves to protect your hands and put their mixture on with your fingers.

steps.title: Let the mixture sit for 30 to 60 minutes.
steps.content: Let the mixture sit for 30 to 60 minutes. Do not let the mixture sit on your hair for longer than 1 hour, or it could damage your hair. Check on your hair after 30 minutes to see if it’s light enough. If not, leave it on longer and keep checking it every 10 minutes. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Rinse your hair out with cold water.
steps.content: Rinse your hair out with cold water. Make sure you remove every bit of the baking soda mixture from your hair so that it stops lightening. Use cold water to close your hair cuticles and protect the lighter red color. [14] X Research source Depending on how dark your hair is, this method could lighten it 1 to 2 shades.

steps.title: Mix 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of lemon juice with 3 US tbsp (44 mL) of conditioner.
steps.content: Mix 1 US tbsp (15 mL) of lemon juice with 3 US tbsp (44 mL) of conditioner. Use a plastic bowl that you can take into the bathroom with you. Mix your ingredients together until the lemon juice is fully incorporated with the conditioner. [15] X Research source Lemon juice is acidic so it is a natural lightener. Mixing it with conditioner helps to protect your hair and add moisture back in. You can use store-bought lemon juice or squeeze juice from a lemon for a fresh option. You can also use coconut oil instead of conditioner.

steps.title: Wet your hair in the sink or the shower.
steps.content: Wet your hair in the sink or the shower. Make sure your entire head gets fully soaked and that your hair is wet from the ends to the roots. You can wash your hair with your normal shampoo if you’d like to. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Apply the mixture with your hands from the ends to the roots.
steps.content: Apply the mixture with your hands from the ends to the roots. Pick up globs of the conditioner and start rubbing them into your hair from the bottom up. Make sure your entire head gets covered, including the back and your roots. [17] X Research source Sit outside with the lemon juice in your hair if it’s sunny out. The UV rays will make the lemon juice work faster.

steps.title: Rinse out your hair with cold water after 10 minutes.
steps.content: Rinse out your hair with cold water after 10 minutes. Lemon juice is fairly acidic, so it doesn’t need a long time to work. Use cold water to protect your hair health and smooth down your cuticles. [18] X Research source Make sure you rinse out all of the lemon juice so that the acidity doesn’t damage your hair.

steps.title: Keep applying the lemon juice for about 2 weeks every day.
steps.content: Keep applying the lemon juice for about 2 weeks every day. Try not to use the lemon juice for longer than 2 weeks to prevent damage to your hair. Once your red hair is light enough, you can stop using the lemon juice mixture. [19] X Research source Lemon juice can lighten your hair 1 to 2 shades over time.
